name: Muslim Foundation
mission: THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN TO PROMOTE LIFE OF ALL MUSLIMS (PARTICULARLY FOLLOWERS OF JAFRI FAITH) IN ACCORDANCE WITH DIVINE LAWS...

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 22/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions a program expense ratio of 72.4% and strong financial health, but doesn't adequately address the significant deductions due to the lack of beneficiary data, weak governance (1 board member), and excessive working capital. These factors heavily contribute to the low impact score of 8/50 and should be explicitly mentioned in the rationale.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 1 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Foundation Inc earns 23/100 due to moderate alignment and limited impact (significant risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The organization's mission focuses on the Jafri faith and religious programs.
Financial data includes total revenue of $2,504,911, a 72.4% program expense ratio, 74.8 months of working capital, and fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised.
The organization accepts donations through various methods for its community programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows strong financial stability and low fundraising costs, but its overall score is tempered by limited third-party impact data and a highly specialized religious focus.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external verification of program impact and outcomes
Narrower donor alignment due to specific focus on the Jafri faith

dimension_explanations.alignment: The mission is specifically centered on followers of the Jafri faith, which may result in a lower fit for general donors seeking broad-based humanitarian causes [1]. While the organization provides essential religious and cultural infrastructure, its specialized focus and the lack of comprehensive impact reporting contribute to a medium alignment score [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation maintains a program expense ratio of 72.4%, directing the majority of its $2,504,911 revenue toward direct services like the Sadiq School and daily prayers [2]. While financial health is robust with 74.8 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available data regarding specific beneficiary outcomes or third-party effectiveness evaluations [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Foundation Inc serves the religious and educational needs of the Jafri community through daily prayers and specialized schooling.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.04 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 74.8 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Somerset, New Jersey, Muslim Foundation Inc operates Masjid-e-Ali and the Sadiq School to promote a life guided by divine laws [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $2,504,911 and manages programs focused on religious observance and community education [2]. Donors can support these initiatives through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods [3].

all_citations.quote: Donation methods include PayPal and Credit Card

all_citations.claim: daily prayers, funeral services, and resident scholar guidance
all_citations.quote: Promote life of all Muslims. in accordance with divine laws
Revenue growth from $1.3M to $2.5M over three years

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows strong financial stability and low fundraising costs, but its overall score is tempered by limited third-party impact data and a highly specialized religious focus.

areas_for_improvement.detail: The organization currently operates with a <cite id="6">board size of only 1 member</cite>, which presents a risk to independent oversight and institutional checks and balances.
There is currently <cite id="6">no public tracking of beneficiary counts</cite> or external evaluations to verify the specific outcomes of its educational programs.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization does not currently meet BBB standards due to its <cite id="6">single-member board structure</cite>.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's 42-year history and significant asset base provide some assurance of operational continuity despite governance concerns.
risk_factors: <cite id="6">Board consists of only 1 member</cite>, which falls below best practice standards for non-profit oversight.
<cite id="6">No external evaluation</cite> or outcome tracking for the Sadiq School or other programs.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="6">concentrated governance</cite> and a lack of standardized impact reporting.

confidence.notes: Financial data is strong, but governance and impact data are limited.

alignment.explanation: The organization has a <cite id="4">strong track record of 42 years</cite> serving the Jafri community, though its <cite id="6">low Muslim donor fit score</cite> stems from a lack of broad humanitarian focus.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="6">highlighting the humanitarian dimensions</cite> of its community work and establishing a clear sadaqah-use policy.

credibility.explanation: The foundation is a long-standing institution with <cite id="2">verified financial filings</cite> and a substantial asset base. However, credibility is limited by a <cite id="6">single-member board</cite> and the absence of third-party transparency seals.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="6">expand its board to at least five independent members</cite> and publish audited financial statements.

impact.explanation: The charity provides direct services with a <cite id="2">71.3% program ratio</cite>. While it maintains <cite id="1">excessive working capital of 74.8 months</cite>, it lacks a formal theory of change.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="6">tracking and reporting beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a clear cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Direct service provision with limited outcome data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct provision of services rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim Foundation Inc serves the religious and educational needs of the Jafri community through daily prayers and specialized schooling.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who wish to support the long-term religious and educational infrastructure of the Jafri Muslim community in the United States.
donor_motivations: Value the preservation of specialized religious education
Want to support established local masjids with deep community roots
Prefer giving to organizations with extremely low fundraising overhead
Interested in supporting funeral services and resident scholar guidance
giving_considerations: Donations are for sadaqah and general religious purposes, not zakat
The organization has very high reserves, meaning immediate funding needs may be lower than peers
Governance is highly centralized with a single board member
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-impact humanitarian relief or those who require rigorous, third-party verified outcome metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects direct service delivery but a <cite id="6">lack of verified outcome data</cite> or external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation operates on the implicit theory that providing consistent religious services and faith-based schooling strengthens the spiritual and social fabric of the Jafri community.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps donors understand how their contributions translate into improved educational or spiritual outcomes for the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the foundation has <cite id="1">significant reserves</cite>, its <cite id="5">37.3% revenue growth</cite> suggests expanding community needs and potential for program scaling.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="1">unusually high working capital ratio</cite> compared to the <cite id="5">peer program ratio median of 80.0%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar size but broader grantmaking focus
similar_organizations.name: Pillars Fund

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on religious services and community schooling
similar_organizations.name: MAS Boston Society

strengths.detail: The foundation operates with minimal overhead in its development efforts, spending only <cite id="1">$0.04 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
The organization maintains a very strong liquidity position, holding <cite id="1">74.8 months of working capital</cite> to ensure long-term operational stability.
The charity has demonstrated significant expansion in its resource base, achieving a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 37.3%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Foundation Inc exhibits a high degree of financial resilience, characterized by its <cite id="2">$12,839,041 in total assets</cite> against relatively low liabilities. This fiscal health is bolstered by a diversified revenue stream that includes <cite id="2">$1,371,915 in direct contributions</cite> and <cite id="2">$167,402 in program service revenue</cite>, suggesting a sustainable model that combines community support with fee-based educational services. Furthermore, its <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised</cite> is significantly better than many peer organizations, ensuring that the vast majority of donor funds are available for the foundation's religious and educational programming.
rich_narrative.summary: Based in Somerset, New Jersey, Muslim Foundation Inc serves as a vital hub for the Jafri community, operating Masjid-e-Ali and the Sadiq School to promote a life guided by divine laws. The organization maintains a significant financial footprint, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $2,504,911</cite> in the 2023 tax year. Its operations are centered on providing <cite id="4">daily prayers, funeral services, and resident scholar guidance</cite>, alongside formal educational tracks through the <cite id="4">Sadiq School and Jafaria School</cite>. Financially, the foundation demonstrates a commitment to direct service, allocating a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 72.4%</cite> toward its core religious and educational missions. While the organization is established and well-resourced, with <cite id="2">total assets exceeding $12.8 million</cite>, it operates with a highly specialized focus on the religious and cultural needs of its local congregation.
